entry.title: ericschumann12/InvestigatoR
entry.summary:
What the Package Does (Title Case)

InvestigatoR

The goal of InvestigatoR is to …

Installation

You can install the development version of InvestigatoR from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("ericschumann12/InvestigatoR")

Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

library(InvestigatoR)
## basic example code

What is special about using README.Rmd instead of just README.md? You can include R chunks like so:

performance(c(1,2,NA,3))
#> [1] 2

You’ll still need to render README.Rmd regularly, to keep README.md up-to-date. devtools::build_readme() is handy for this.

You can also embed plots, for example:

In that case, don’t forget to commit and push the resulting figure files, so they display on GitHub and CRAN.
